name: reconception
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a new or different idea of what something or someone is like, or a new or different basic understanding of a situation or a principle: It is revolutionary because it opens the way to a reconception of community. This is a powerfully argued re-conception of the issues.
More examplesFewer examplesThis reconception of education involves developing computer-mediated environments in which learners can teach themselves.The restructuring included a fundamental re-conception of job roles and responsibilities.There has to be a reconception of what we are dealing with.
